page.title: 10Leisure Time in Glenisla.
page.content: Although the population is small,the leisure activities of the Glenisla residents are many and varied. There is a playgroup for the pre-school children at which they can get to know each other. This is important since homes are widely separated. It also allows mums to get together to compare notes! Glenisla has a fairly large community hall in which many social events or occasions are held. The Games Club meets on a Monday evening when carpet bowls and darts are played. Badminton is held on Wednesday evenings for the younger people and this is well attended. Shields and trophies are competed for in both clubs and a social evening is held at the end of the season when prizes are presented. Regular dances and concerts are held in the hall.
